com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface getFulfillmentOptionsForLines

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface getFulfillmentOptionsForLines

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getFulfillmentOptionsForLines(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getFulfillmentOptionsForLines API can be used to obtain available fulfillment options, which include delivery options, shipping options, and pickup options, for a set of new or existing order lines.

    • Method Detail

      • getFulfillmentOptionsForLines

        org.w3c.dom.Document getFulfillmentOptionsForLines(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                   org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                            throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                   java.rmi.RemoteException

        The getFulfillmentOptionsForLines API can be used to obtain available fulfillment options, which include delivery options, shipping options, and pickup options, for a set of new or existing order lines. The API will form the possible evaluated options based on existing unique combinations of ship-to addresses, fulfillment types, levels of services, and carrier services (for shipping options), ship-to addresses, fulfillment types, and levels of service (for delivery options), and pickup nodes, fulfillment types, and levels of service (for pickup options) of the provided order in the EvaluateOrder element. However, the API will not form evaluated options for the order lines with delivery method as Cash And Carry ("CARRY"). Each possible option will be returned as EvaluateOption in the output XML and the types of options (Delivery, Shipping, and Pickup) will be represented by the DeliveryMethod's values ("DEL", "SHP", and "PICK") respectively.

        After forming the EvaluateOptions, the getFulfillmentOptionsForLines API will utilize the logic of the findInventory API to solve the EvaluateOption for each inquired promise line. Information in the EvaluateOption will serve as overridden values for the corresponding values specified on the promise line. The suggested option of the findInventory call will be returned for each promise line under the Option element based on the information in associated to the EvaluateOption (indicates by OptionNo). For more information, please refer to the findInventory API.

        Note: Existing line dependencies and constraints across order lines will not be considered by the getFulfillmentOptionsForLines API. This API supports bundle without any service components. Any service components will be ignored. Components will be fulfilled based on Bundle Fulfillment Mode.

        Predetermined information such as carrier service, ship-to address, pickup node, and delivery method can also be provided as an option to be evaluated under the element in the input XML. When an option is provided as in the input XML, the getFulfillmentOptionsForLines API will only solve based on the information provided in the option.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        See also: Additional Information

        User Exits:

          Please refer to the user exits of the findInventory API.

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions:None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Partial.

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Additional Information

        The following logic will be used in forming and applying different types of options to be evaluated based on the information on the EvaluateOrder.

        Delivery Options:
        Delivery options will be formed base on the unique combinations of fulfillment type and ship-to addresses of existing order lines with DeliveryMethod="DEL". The evaluated delivery options will be solved for each promised line if the item has IsDeliveryAllowed="Y" or "M". While solving the evaluated delivery option for each promised line, system will not use any specific DS Items. Delivery options will only provide information of available nodes to perform the delivery base on the delivery sourcing configuration. When delivery option is not possible, the API will add a shipping option with the same address (if not already existed) for the item with (IsDeliveryAllowed="M" and there are no available delivery options).

        Shipping Options:
        Shipping options will be formed base on the unique combinations of fulfillment type, ship-to addresses and carrier services on the order lines with DeliveryMethod="SHP". The evaluated shipping options will be solved for each promised line if the item has IsShippingAllowed="Y" or (IsShippingAllowed="M" and there are no available delivery options). Furthermore, shipping options will be solved for each promise line if the item does not exist in the catalog.

        Pickup Options:
        Pickup options will be formed base on the unique combinations of fulfillment type and pickup nodes on the order lines with DeliveryMethod="PICK". The evaluated pickup options will be solved for each promised line if the item has IsPickupAllowed="Y". While solving for pickup options, procurement will be ignored.

        Pending Changes
        If there are pending changes on the order, they will be applied first internally, prior to evaluation of this API.

        Integration with Inventory Visibility (phase 2.0) enabled:
        Features not supported in IV- availability by tag, segment, items with variation, GTIN, VMI, time-sensitive breakdown, multi-brand won't be supported.
        User exits com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetExternalSupplyUE, com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE, com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetDemandCorrectionsUE won't be supported with IV integration.
        Instead of reading supplies and demands from IV, node availability api of IV shall be invoked and the availabilities at node/s will be modelled as supplies.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by createEnvironment.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        Returns:
        For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
